intro: Verbesina pterocarpha, commonly known as the winged beggar-ticks, is a herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy stems with wing-like structures. The plant produces small, yellow-orange flowers that are clustered in spherical heads, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Verbesina pterocarpha is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
